p: Eugenol was found to inhibit the growth of human isolates of Streptococcus agalactiae (planktonic GBSâ€”group B streptococci strain), including those resistant to erythromycin and clindamycin [ 21]. After a five-hour incubation with 0.125% to 0.5% eugenol, the GBS planktonic cells demonstrated leakage of proteins and lipids from the cytoplasm and disruption of the cell membrane.
